rComments: She gave super interesting lectures! The material was easy to understand but fascinating at the same time. She's super nice, approachable, and down to earth.
Great professor! Lectures are a bit long but she tries to get through them in a timely manner.

Sarah Shrader is amazing!  She teaches to multiple learning styles and is a very open professor. If you have a disability that affects your schooling she is the best teacher to take classes from. She is understanding and very accommodating to   students with disabilities. I never felt shy about asking her to repeat information over and over.

Took the class last quarter. Extremely easy if you go to class and take decent notes. The tests are multiple choice and VERY easy if you study. Overall a very enjoyable class and very interesting. Good about letting you know when  you should have things done.

Lectures were always interesting. You need to attend class and take notes since she doesn't post PP slides and the material covered in any assigned books are only a sliver of the actual lecture content. Assignments were 2 literary critiques (from reading) + 6 in-class critiques of lectures or films + scantron final. Greatly enjoyed it!

Schrader was clear, enthusiastic, and very knowledgeable about the material. She encouraged questions and inquiry and very clearly went over her presentations. Films included in class enhanced the material. She also does very cool research and relates the class back to her work. You don't have to be super science oriented to take the class either!

Good professor, is willing to help any student and is quick to respond to emails. She is young but definitely knows what she's talking about and is very passionate about the subject. Her lectures are straight forward, if you read and attend class, very possible to get an A. On both midterms, there were multiple students who got 100%

She's makes the class rather boring and her monotone voice makes it very hard to stay focused.  I don't believe that she should be teaching as she doesn't engage students whatsoever.  Anyone with even a slight amount of enthusiasm in their voice would've made it more enjoyable.

The lectures are straightforward and provide a really good recap of the chapters.  Get ready to take a BUNCH of notes however. Most of the test material comes from her slideshows, but she doesn't post them online. It's absolutely crucial that you come to lectures! Gotta say, Professor Schrader is really cool, approachable and super chill.

I went into this class for the GE and switched my major to Anthropology because of it. Her lectures are interesting and she is clear about what is expected. Tests are relatively easy (especially if you do the reading). Nothing unexpected on the exams. Reading is not required but definitely helps and her lectures follow the assigned chapters.
